newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy confidence vote set for Wednesday night.
newsitem.headline: Italy confidence vote set for Wednesday night.

text.p: A vote of confidence called by the government of Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi on its plan to rescue a troubled bank will be held on Wednesday night, parliamentary officials said.
Party leaders decided that the vote would take place at about 1830 GMT in the Chamber of Deputies (lower house) after a debate.
The government called the vote earlier on Tuesday to ensure that a crucial cabinet decree covering a rescue plan for heavily indebted Banco di Napoli passes swiftly into law.

Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi announced the measure in parliament after the cabinet met to decide how the government should respond to filibustering tactics by the secessionist Northern League.
